key_work.title: Citizenfour
key_work.creator_credit: Mathilde Bonnefoy, Dirk Wilutzky, Laura Poitras, JustFilms / Ford Foundation, The Bertha Foundation, RADiUS-TWC and Kirsten Johnson
key_work.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014
key_work.brief_description: Laura Poitras blurs the line between documentary and investigative journalism. Poitras was one of three journalists confided in by whistleblower Edward Snowden when he shared classified documents that detailed global government surveillance. Telling his story earned Poitras a Pulitzer, while Citizenfour won an Oscar.

end.brief_description: John Anderton is a top ‘Precrime’ cop in the late-21st century, when technology can predict crimes before they’re committed. But Anderton becomes the quarry when another investigator targets him for a murder charge.

links.description: Schlosberg’s arrest typifies police overreach, an issue explored through the exaggerated lens of Minority Report’s ‘pre-crime’ unit. The film depicts a future where arrests occur before a crime has been committed, thanks to the visions of a trio of psychic siblings.

end.title: The Lives of Others
end.creator_credit: Max Wiedemann, Quirin Berg, ARD, Sony Pictures Classics and Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck
end.brief_description: A tragic love story set in East Berlin with the backdrop of an undercover Stasi controlled culture. Stasi captain Wieler is ordered to follow author Dreyman and plunges deeper and deeper into his life until he reaches the threshold of doubting the system.

constellations_other.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_other.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

links.description: Instead of imagining a future where people are condemned on suspicion and unsubstantiated claims, The Lives of Others simply goes back to Soviet-ruled East Germany in 1984. In the film, a Stasi agent surveils a playwright and an actress, but instead of condemning them for dissent, comes to care for them from afar.

links.description: Mr. Robot explores political and social dissent in a contemporary setting, taking inspiration from real-world hacker groups like Anonymous to tell the story of a mentally fragile hacker drawn into a battle with big business and government forces over the soul of America.

end.title: Watch_Dogs
end.brief_description: Set in Chicago, where a central network of computers connects everyone and everything, Watch_Dogs explores the impact of technology within our society. Using the city as your weapon, you will embark on a personal mission to inflict your own brand of justice.

links.description: Although a rich topic for film and TV hacking had not featured as a prominent and powerful videogame mechanic before Watch Dogs, a third-person game where players remotely hack into an array of infrastructural systems to succeed in the game.
